III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/12/24, the Director instructed Staff 1 to rape a youth, and
Staff 1 refused.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
0812/2024.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 08/13/2024 via
telephone. Foster Care Worker reported she met with Youth A at
the facility on 08/12/2024, Youth A told her that he overheard
Director tell Staff 1 to rape Youth A. Foster Care Worker said she
is not sure that Youth A was being truthful. Youth A did not
provide a date or time when he heard the Director tell Staff 1 to
rape Youth A.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024.
Administrator reported Youth A was arrested on 08/12/2024 and
transferred to the Wayne County Jail due to assaulting staff.
Administrator denied having any knowledge of Director telling
Staff 1 to rape Youth A. Administrator reported Youth A has a
history of making false allegations when he gets in trouble.
Director was currently off work for medical reasons.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024. Therapist
has been working at the facility for 5 years. She has been working
with Youth A for approximately one month. Therapist denied
witnessing or hearing that Director had told Staff 1 to rape Youth
A. Youth A had never reported or disclosed anything regarding
Director or Staff 1.
Manager was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024. Manager
reported she has worked closely with Director and has never
heard Director say or do anything inappropriate with any of the
youths. She said Youth A was arrested on 08/12/2024 for
attempting to assault staff and believes that Youth A is saying this
in retaliation for getting in trouble.
2

Youth A was interviewed at the Wayne County Jail on
08/16/2024. Youth A reported he was placed at Calumet Center
for approximately one month. Youth A reported there was an
incident, but he could not recall the date. Youth A heard Director
tell Staff 1 to go and rape Youth A in his room. Youth A said he
was in his room when this happened. Youth A said he immediately
walked out of his room, and he did not have any interactions with
Director or Staff 1 regarding what he heard. Youth A said this
happened in Pod 3 and there were no other youths or staff on the
Pod with him. Youth A denied Staff 1 did anything to him.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were interviewed at the facility on 08/16/2024.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 denied witnessing or hearing that Director had
told Staff 1 to rape Youth A. Both staff members were shocked
when they heard the allegations. Staff 2 and Staff 3 expressed no
concerns regarding Director.
Director was interviewed on 08/20/2024 via telephone. Director
has been working at the facility for 6 months. Director denied ever
directing a staff member to do anything inappropriate with any of
the youths. Director was shocked when he heard the allegations.
Staff 1 resigned from the facility on 08/31/2024. An attempt was
made to contact Staff 1 via telephone on 08/20/2024, but the
phone number was not a working number. An attempt was made
to email Staff 1 on 09/11/2024 and 09/18/2024 requesting return
contact, but no respond was received.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 08/12/2024, written by Manager. At
approximately 9:00 am Youth A used a handmade shank to
threaten staff, Safety and Support Coordinators responded
and retrieved the shank. At approximately 12:18 pm Youth
A removed part of the T.V. mount from the ceiling to use as
a weapon. Highland Police Depart was contact and
arrested Youth A. (Note: There are no incident reports
involving Youth A and Director)
• Director and Staff 1 personnel file: They have no
disciplinary records.
• No grievances were filed by Youth A about Staff 1 and
Director.
3

Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with staff and
youths, there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
